title: ESA Selects Companies to Develop in-Orbit Fuel Storage and Refilling Tech
summary: The European Space Agency has selected ArianeGroup, GMV Aerospace and Defence, MT Aerospace, SAB Aerospace, and The Exploration Company to develop in-orbit fuel storage and refilling capabilities. ESA’s selection of the five companies was announced on 9 October during a Future Space Transportation Award Ceremony in Paris. The selections were made as part of the […]

title: Gateway: Centering Science
summary: Gateway is set to advance science in deep space, bringing groundbreaking research opportunities to lunar orbit.

title: China selects 2 proposals for crewed moon rover
summary: HELSINKI — China’s human spaceflight agency has selected two teams to develop prototype rovers for the country’s planned crewed moon mission before the end of the decade. The country last […]

title: NASA finds, but does not disclose, root cause of Orion heat shield erosion
summary: NASA has determined why the Orion heat shield lost more material than expected on the Artemis 1 mission but won’t disclose details until after it completes more tests.

title: Rocket builder Firefly’s new CEO is working ‘maniacally’ to scale launches, spacecraft and moon missions
summary: Jason Kim just nabbed one of the most coveted yet high-pressure C-suite gigs in the space industry.

title: Ariel takes shape and first shake
summary: The construction phase of ESA’s Ariel mission has started at Airbus Defence and Space in Toulouse (France) with the assembly of the spacecraft’s structural model. This marks a significant step forward for this mission designed to meticulously inspect the atmospheres of a thousand exoplanets and uncover their nature.

title: Austria’s iSEE sets up U.S. subsidiary
summary: SAN FRANCISCO – Austrian space domain awareness startup iSEE Global established a U.S. subsidiary in Arlington, Virginia, led by former Kleos Space CEO Andy Bowyer. The U.S. subsidiary of iSEE, […]

title: Sols 4345-4347: Contact Science is Back on the Table
summary: Earth planning date: Friday, Oct. 25, 2024 The changes to the plan Wednesday, moving the drive a sol earlier, meant that we started off planning this morning about 18 meters (about 59 feet) farther along the western edge of Gediz Vallis and with all the data we needed for planning. This included the knowledge that […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 20 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg SFB
summary: The launch will also add another 13 satellites featuring Direct to Cell capabilities to SpaceX’s growing constellation. Liftoff is set for 4:07 a.m. PDT (7:07 a.m. EDT, 1107 UTC).

title: ExoAnalytic observes 500 pieces of debris from Intelsat 33e breakup
summary: U.S.-based space-tracking company ExoAnalytic Solutions has identified about 500 pieces of debris from Intelsat 33e’s recent breakup in geostationary orbit.
